Html:
Hi Guys,

I downloaded the SQL Server 2000 Sample databases and now I want to install the SQL server version of the Northwind.mdf sample database by running this command in the command prompt, but unfortunately, I get the errot message that you see:

C:\SQL Server 2000 Sample Databases>osql -E -Q "EXEC sp_attach_db N'Northwind',N'c:\SQL Server 2000 Sample Databases\northwind.mdf'"
[SQL Server Native Client 10.0]Named Pipes Provider: Could not open a
connection to SQL Server [2].
[SQL Server Native Client 10.0]Login timeout expired
[SQL Server Native Client 10.0]A network-related or instance-specific error
has occurred while establishing a connection to SQL Server. Server is not
found or not accessible. Check if instance name is correct and if SQL Server
is configured to allow remote connections. For more information see SQL Server
Books Online.

I am using SQL 2008 Express Edition. Please help. Thanks.

I also posted this here: http://social.msdn.microsoft.com/Forums/en-US/ssdsgetstarted/thread/f81b81a3-119b-400a-ada8-40f3aaf96017

OK, I got this one sorted!

The command >osql -E -S .\SQLEXPRESS -i instnwnd.sql worked after the umpteenth try.
